input.text:
Issue Summary : Servicing failure by Maximus Education XXXX ( XXXX Aidvantage ) led to derogatory credit reporting without borrower notification or account access. Despite full repayment and escalation, Ive received no resolution. 

What Happened? 
Aidvantage reported a late payment to the credit bureaus on a XXXX  student loan in my name, even though I, the legal borrower, was never contacted, never granted account access, and never notified of resumed repayment or delinquency. 

I discovered this only after seeing a XXXX point drop in my credit score, which severely impacted my ability to access business credit. Upon discovery, I immediately : -Paid the loan in full -Updated all contact information -Registered for account access ( for the XXXX  time ever ) -Submitted a formal goodwill adjustment request outlining the servicing failures Aidvantage ignored the core facts, sent XXXX canned responses, and never produced any evidence of contacting me, the borrower. Their only defense was that messages were posted to my " inbox, '' a portal I couldnt access because I was never given login credentials or account info. 

Servicing Failures ( All Documented ) : -No repayment notice after COVID forbearance ended ( a requirement under federal loan guidelines ) -No billing statements, emails, or delinquency alerts sent to me, only to my parents, despite being the borrower -No opportunity to cure the alleged delinquency prior to credit reporting ( a possible FCRA violation ) -No login credentials or account access ever provided, I could not monitor or pay this account until after the derogatory mark was made -No evidence ever provided by Aidvantage that communication attempts were made to me Federal Oversight Failure : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a detailed complaint to the XXXX XXXX XXXX Ombudsman Group . Their auto-reply promised a response within XXXX days. 

I received no response. 

On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a second follow-up directly through the XXXX platform. 

It is now XX/XX/year> over XXXX days later and the case is still marked " In Review '' with no reply. This government silence has left me with no further path to resolution except for this CFPB filing. 

Requested Resolution : I am respectfully asking the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to : -Investigate Aidvantages failure to provide borrower-level communication or account access -Support my request for a Goodwill Adjustment and removal of the derogatory mark from all major credit bureaus -Review the breakdown in oversight and responsiveness from the XXXX XXXX XXXX Ombudsman Group Why This Matters : XXXXI have made every effort in good faith to resolve this without escalation. 

XXXXThe loan was relatively small and has been fully repaid. 

XXXXThe derogatory mark was caused solely by servicer negligence, not borrower behavior. 

XXXXThe late mark caused a XXXX point drop in my XXXX score, destroying XXXX years of perfect credit history. 

XXXXThis has directly damaged my small business, which depends on access to credit. 

XXXXI am not seeking to avoid responsibility only fairness.
I am submitting this complaint regarding unauthorized interest accrual on my XXXX XXXX XXXX  enrolled in the SAVE ( Saving on a XXXX XXXX ) plan. Despite the Department of Education 's explicit guidance that loans under the SAVE plan should not accrue interest during the administrative forbearance period, Aidvantage has allowed interest to accrue on my account, resulting in an increase in my loan balance. 

Here is a summary of the issue and timeline : Department of Education Guidance : The Department of Education mandated that all borrowers enrolled in the SAVE plan be placed into an interest-free administrative forbearance beginning XX/XX/XXXX, due to ongoing legal challenges. During this period, no interest was supposed to accrue on loans. 

Aidvantage 's Actions : Aidvantage stated in their letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, that my loans were in a general forbearance with no interest accruing from XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. 

However, they claim that when I submitted a new Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) application on XX/XX/XXXX, my loans were moved into a " processing forbearance '' for up to 60 days. During this processing forbearance, Aidvantage allowed interest to accrue on my loans starting XX/XX/XXXX, despite my enrollment in the SAVE plan. 

When my application was not processed within the 60-day window, Aidvantage states that my account was moved back into a general forbearance effective XX/XX/XXXX, during which interest was set to 0 %. 

Impact : My loan balance increased from {$72000.00} ( as of XX/XX/XXXX ) to {$73000.00} as of nowa difference of {$1300.00} in unauthorized accrued interest. 

This interest accrual violates the Department of Educations directive that loans under the SAVE plan should not accrue interest during administrative forbearance. 

Attempts to Resolve : I have made over a dozen phone calls to Aidvantage since XX/XX/XXXX, totaling more than 12 hours of time spent trying to resolve this issue. 

During each call, I was promised a supervisor callback within 24-48 business hours, but no supervisor has ever followed up with me. 

I escalated this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB Complaint # XXXX ), but Aidvantage falsely reported to the CFPB that the issue was resolved when it was not. 

Why This Is a Problem : Aidvantages actions are inconsistent with federal regulations and Department of Education mandates regarding the SAVE plan. The Department explicitly stated that borrowers enrolled in SAVE should not accrue interest during administrative forbearance. By allowing interest to accrue during the processing forbearance period ( XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ), Aidvantage has violated these directives. 

Additionally : Their explanation in their XX/XX/XXXX letter does not align with federal guidance. 

Their failure to follow through on promised callbacks and their false reporting to the CFPB demonstrate systemic issues in their handling of borrower complaints.

What I Am Requesting : Immediate removal of the {$1300.00} in unauthorized accrued interest from my account. 

Restoration of my loan balance to {$72000.00} as it was in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Written confirmation from Aidvantage detailing these corrections and assurances that no further interest will accrue while my account remains under administrative forbearance as mandated by the Department of Education.

Accountability for Aidvantages false reporting to the CFPB and failure to provide adequate customer service. 

A formal investigation into whether Aidvantage is systematically violating Department of Education mandates regarding SAVE plan borrowers.

This issue has caused significant stress and wasted time due to Aidvantages noncompliance and lack of accountability. I request immediate action from both Aidvantage and federal authorities to resolve this matter fairly and ensure compliance with federal regulations moving forward. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, XXXX
I applied for and was officially approved under the Biden Administrations SAVE Plan a federal Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) program through Aidvantage, my servicer, as directed by the U.S. Department of Education . 

Despite following all application instructions and being granted approval, I am now unable to locate any record of that SAVE Plan approval or correspondence in my servicers system or communication history. My aid data shows Im placed in an Income-Based Repayment plan ( IBR ), which is not the same as the SAVE Plan I applied for and was approved under.

I believe that critical communications have been either removed, withheld, or retroactively altered, and I suspect administrative interference from the Trump Administration following the transition in the presidential administration. This is not only unethical it violates borrower protections, federal transparency statutes, and my repayment rights. 

I urgently request investigation into this matter, full restoration and documentation of my original SAVE Plan approval, and accountability from Aidvantage and/or the Department of Education if records were altered or destroyed.

Product : Federal Student Loan Income-Driven Repayment Plan ( SAVE Plan ) and IDR Issue : Incorrect loan terms/ repayment plan provided Communication or account documentation missing Company : Aidvantage ( Dept. of Education Servicer ) What do you want the company to do to fix this problem?

Reissue and provide a dated copy of my SAVE Plan approval letter under the Biden Administration! 
Restore my original SAVE Plan enrollment and IDR Investigate the improper data handling under the Trump Administration!

Prevent further borrower harm due to policy interference and Trump administrative actions!
XXXX, enacted in 1974, is designed to protect the privacy of student education records, restricting unauthorized access and disclosure. Notably, XXXX does not XXXX individuals the right to sue for violations ; enforcement is the federal government 's responsibility. When i signed up for the income driven repayment plan it was a legal binding document recently A federal court issued an injunction preventing the U.S. Department of Education from implementing the Saving on a Valuable Education ( SAVE ) Plan and parts of other income-driven repayment ( IDR ) plans. The online income-driven repayment ( IDR ) plan and loan consolidation applications are available. My FERPA. XXXX XXXX was not and is not an elected official of the United States Government I am reaching out to provide important information regarding the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( XXXX ) a federal law that protects the privacy of student education records.

What is FERPA?

FERPA grants parents and eligible students ( those over XXXX  or attending a postsecondary institution ) the right to : 1. Inspect and review their education records maintained by the school. 
XXXX. Request corrections to records they believe are inaccurate or misleading. 
3. Control the disclosure of personally identifiable information from education records, except under certain permitted conditions.

Who Can Access Education Records?

Generally, schools must have written permission from a parent or eligible student to release any information from a students education record. However, FERPA allows disclosure without consent to certain parties or under specific conditions, such as : School officials with legitimate educational interests Other schools to which a student is transferring Accrediting organizations Compliance with a judicial order or subpoena. XXXX XXXX did not have XXXX order and or subpoena to have access to my student loan information.

FERPA allows schools to disclose directory information ( such as a students name, address, and honors received ) without consent unless parents or eligible students opt out. Schools must inform families of this policy and provide time to request that directory information not be disclosed. The legal due process was not taken

input.question: How does FERPA protect student loan borrowers from data breaches?
input.context:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX complaint I am writing to formally dispute my federal student loan obligations due to significant breach of my personal and financial information. My private data was compromised without my authorization, violating multiple federal laws designed to protect student records and personal privacy. Under the following legal protections, my information should have been safeguarded : Federal Educational Rights and Privacy ( FERPA ) : Ensures the confidentiality of students records and prohibits the unauthorized disclosure of personal information.

Higher Education Act ( HEA ) : Establishes the responsibility of educational institutions and loan servicer 's to protect student data.

Privacy Act 1974 : Prohibits the unauthorized sharing of personal information held by federal agencies.

Breach of Contract : The unauthorized sharing of student loan borrowers ' personal and financial information with third parties, including XXXX XXXX, DOGE, constitutes a violation of borrower data.

input.question: How does FERPA protect student loan borrowers from data breaches?
input.answer: FERPA (Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act) protects student loan borrowers by ensuring the confidentiality of students' records and prohibiting the unauthorized disclosure of personal information. This legal safeguard helps prevent data breaches by restricting how educational institutions, loan servicers, and federal agencies can share or release student information without proper authorization. In cases where personal and financial data are improperly shared or accessed without consent, FERPA provides a legal basis for borrowers to dispute such breaches and seek remedies, thereby helping to protect their privacy and reduce the risk of data breaches.

sentences.2: In cases where personal and financial data are improperly shared or accessed without consent, FERPA provides a legal basis for borrowers to dispute such breaches and seek remedies, thereby helping to protect their privacy and reduce the risk of data breaches.

This account was transferred to Nelnet ( NNI ) from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ; who had engaged in acts of deception and made numerous errors on the account, as well as having broken numerous consumer protection laws, including the FDCPA, FCRA, TCPA, Indiana Senior Consumer Protection Act, Indiana Deceptive Consumers Sales Act. Despite signing for the CM and acknowledging receipt of the written complaint and violations of law, XXXX never responded to the CM, nor provided any answers to the questions raised in the CM. XXXX never corrected any of the errors- some of which may have been not just errors but deliberate acts of covering-up acts of deception. XXXX seems to have a Compliance Problem.

I was not afforded the education or resources to make an informed decision. I was utilizing the XXXX XXXX  my XXXX XXXX sponsor signed to me and was still pushed to get Federal Loans to complete my degree. I was under significant financial and XXXX  duress at the time because my spouse had just XXXX, 2 months after having our son. My grandmother, who raised me, died a few weeks into his XXXX. I was raising a XXXX  and a XXXX XXXX XXXX at the time. Nelnet is a predator loan servicing company who kept freely pushing for me to take loans without actually explaining anything. I was not in a right state of mind and Nelnet is a private company who profits off oppressed populations such as myself. They have not attempted to help me, their interest is set to keep XXXX, educated women like myself in financial distress. Nelnet is not an ethical company. I have worked with the XXXX Government for YEARS and have been a Federal XXXX for years. I have served this country as a XXXX XXXX and a Therapist and even that doesnt qualify me for student loans repayments???? Nelnet make it IMPOSSIBLE to pay off their predatory loans. It is a XXXX and oppressive system that keeps non-white individuals like myself from truly succeeding.

Additionally, I have become aware of an ongoing data breach involving student loan accounts, which raises serious concerns regarding unauthorized access to my personal and financial information raising concerns over a FERPA violation. Given this security lapse, I have reason to believe that my account records may have been compromised or altered without my consent. 

I am in the process of purchasing a home and this has caused my loan to be halted until this is remedied. This has caused extreme financial distress and this error in reporting needs to be remedied immediately. I did not authorize any changes to my account status, and I no longer feel comfortable having my student loans serviced and reported to the credit bureaus under these conditions. 

Violations and Consumer Protection Rights 1. Failure to Provide Notice of Negative Credit Reporting - Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), loan servicers are required to provide accurate and fair reporting. I was not notified in advance that these accounts would be marked late, which denied me the opportunity to address any potential issues before they were reported.

2. Possible Unauthorized Reporting and Account Compromise Due to Data Breach - The reported data breach involving Nelnet raises serious questions about the integrity of my loan accounts. If my data was exposed or manipulated, Nelnet may have
incorrectly or fraudulently reported late payments that I did not actually incur.

3. Failure to Properly Investigate and Verify Account Status - Given the security risks and errors in reporting, I request full verification and documentation proving the legitimacy of the late payments, including a detailed account history showing how and when they were marked late.
I have XXXX XXXX  that are in the process of being discharged due to misconduct by my school. This process is called borrowers defense, and applies to my loans from the XXXX XXXX. I have attached the emails regarding notification of this matter. According to the Department of Education and Nelnet, this process can take many years. In addition, there is no where I can go as the borrower to see the progress or status of this process. During this process, there should be no negative consequences or impact on me as the borrower. Part of the process for the discharge is a refund of all payments made towards the loans. Due to multiple changes in servicers over the years and the fact that my loans were consolidated, there was very little information available about the specifics of these loans from the very beginning of the process. I previously asked Nelnet in late XXXX for a record of all payments and loans- and I was told at that time that the information was unavailable due to the processing of the borrowers defense case. They did inform me that I would be getting a refund of approximately {$600.00}, which is the full amount they said I paid on these loans in over 10 years. I had serious doubts about that amount, but had XXXX recourse to prove otherwise. They informed me that the payment would be coming from the XXXX Treasury and provided instructions on how to sign up for direct deposit through the IRS website. I enrolled in direct deposit, and on XX/XX/XXXX, I received a deposit in the amount of {$690.00} from the XXXX Treasury. Due to not expecting any other payment, I contacted Nelnet and they confirmed that this is the refund for my borrowers defense case. They informed me that the Department of Education would be sending correspondence to confirm this, but nothing was received. I had spent another few hours at this point between calling Nelnet and the Department of Education, and I let it all go assuming itd all be made clear when the process was complete. 

I enrolled in school for the winter of XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX ) with no issues, and all loans were put into a forbearance status due to being a XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was eligible for financial aid at this point. I took the next semester off, and began the process to enroll for XXXX XXXX. I am going to a different school, so I had to login to update my XXXX form at the beginning of XX/XX/XXXX. Upon logging into the Department of Education, there was a bold warning about my loans being in default. I immediately contacted the Department of Education - because my loans are absolutely not in default and even if they were, there is absolutely no way they could go from good standing in XX/XX/XXXX to default in XX/XX/XXXX due to the amount of time needed to get into a default status. The Department of Education informed me that Nelnet, as the servicer, of these loans is solely responsible for updating loan status. I was told to contact Nelnet. Upping logging into the Nelnet website, there is no information about any late payments, default status or record of the defaulted loans. They are not even reported on my loan history. I called Nelnet, and I was informed that the process of refunding payments during a loan discharge can put the loan into a erroneous status of default. They informed me that there was nothing they could do about this, and I had to wait for the borrowers defense case to be resolved and all information would be updated and made right at that time. I requested a supervisor, who reiterated that there was nothing they could do and that this was just part of the process. I informed them that due to being in a default status, I can not return to school and obtain XXXX XXXX, and there are serious consequences to my credit report. In addition, when the government returns to wage garnishments in XX/XX/XXXX, my wages will be garnished for a defaulted loan that I dont owe. Nelnet again told me they had no solution, and that I just had to wait. They were unable to provide any specific timeline, but did inform me that it will likely be a year or more before any update is made to my account. They informed me that this is because the Department of Education controls all processing and they generally take 3-5 years in total for a borrowers defense case. 

I filed a complaint with the XXXX Department of Education to attempt to resolve this matter in early XX/XX/XXXX, however there has been no resolution to date. I have attached records of my Nelnet account, Department of Education account, deposit of refund, and original emails informing me of approval of my borrowers defense case. There is no other correspondence available by either entity, nor any other correspondence sent to me.

input.question: What issues are being raised regarding Nelnet in the consumer's complaint?
input.answer:
The issues being raised regarding Nelnet in the consumer's complaints include:

1. **Failure to Respond to Complaints and Correct Errors:** Consumers reported that Nelnet did not respond to multiple certified mail complaints detailing misconduct and violations of consumer protection laws, and failed to correct errors on their accounts.

2. **Legal Violations and Deceptive Practices:** Consumers allege that Nelnet engaged in acts of deception, made numerous errors, and broke laws such as the FDCPA, FCRA, TCPA, and state consumer protection acts.

3. **Negative Credit Reporting Without Notice:** Consumers experienced unjustified negative credit reporting, including late payment entries and default status updates, without prior notice or opportunity to address the issues.

4. **Data Breach and Unauthorized Access:** Concerns were raised about a possible data breach involving Nelnet, raising fears of unauthorized access and potential account manipulation or fraud.

5. **Incorrect Default Status and Loan Discharges:** Consumers reported that Nelnet erroneously marked loans as in default during the borrower defense process, which impacted their ability to return to school and caused credit and financial issues.

6. **Lack of Transparency and Account Status Updates:** Consumers expressed frustration over the inability to access clear information about the status of their loans, especially during discharge or defense processes, and Nelnet's failure to provide timely updates.

7. **Delays in Processing and Resolution:** Consumers noted that Nelnet indicated that resolving issues related to borrower defense claims or loan status updates could take years, with no specific timelines provided.

Overall, the complaints depict Nelnet as failing to respond adequately to consumer concerns, engaging in questionable practices, and causing significant financial and credit distress through errors, lack of communication, and alleged misconduct.

input.response:
The issues being raised regarding Nelnet in the consumer's complaints include:

1. **Failure to Respond to Complaints and Correct Errors:** Consumers reported that Nelnet did not respond to multiple certified mail complaints detailing misconduct and violations of consumer protection laws, and failed to correct errors on their accounts.

2. **Legal Violations and Deceptive Practices:** Consumers allege that Nelnet engaged in acts of deception, made numerous errors, and broke laws such as the FDCPA, FCRA, TCPA, and state consumer protection acts.

3. **Negative Credit Reporting Without Notice:** Consumers experienced unjustified negative credit reporting, including late payment entries and default status updates, without prior notice or opportunity to address the issues.

4. **Data Breach and Unauthorized Access:** Concerns were raised about a possible data breach involving Nelnet, raising fears of unauthorized access and potential account manipulation or fraud.

5. **Incorrect Default Status and Loan Discharges:** Consumers reported that Nelnet erroneously marked loans as in default during the borrower defense process, which impacted their ability to return to school and caused credit and financial issues.

6. **Lack of Transparency and Account Status Updates:** Consumers expressed frustration over the inability to access clear information about the status of their loans, especially during discharge or defense processes, and Nelnet's failure to provide timely updates.

7. **Delays in Processing and Resolution:** Consumers noted that Nelnet indicated that resolving issues related to borrower defense claims or loan status updates could take years, with no specific timelines provided.

Overall, the complaints depict Nelnet as failing to respond adequately to consumer concerns, engaging in questionable practices, and causing significant financial and credit distress through errors, lack of communication, and alleged misconduct.

output.question: What issues have consumers raised in their complaints about Nelnet?

input.text:
This account was transferred to Nelnet ( NNI ) from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ; who had engaged in acts of deception and made numerous errors on the account, as well as having broken numerous consumer protection laws, including the FDCPA, FCRA, TCPA, Indiana Senior Consumer Protection Act, Indiana Deceptive Consumers Sales Act. This occurred in XXXX and XXXX. We then sent letters to Nelnet by Certified Mail ( CM ) several times in XXXX and XXXX, detailing the serious misconduct by XXXX. 

Despite signing for the CM and acknowledging receipt of the written complaint and violations of law, XXXX never responded to the CM, nor provided any answers to the questions raised in the CM. XXXX never corrected any of the errors- some of which may have been not just errors but deliberate acts of covering-up acts of deception. XXXX then began a series of doing many of the same violations of law. 

XXXX seems to have a Compliance Problem.
I am a XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, who is the spouse of an XXXX XXXX XXXX that is being unfairly and unjustly targeted by Nelnet and XXXX XXXX Loans. Just being XXXX in XXXX, I am born with disadvantages. I was not born with the privilege of having a silver spoon in my mouth or the privilege of having parents who can pay for my education. I have had to work twice as hard or more within my career. I have a XXXX  AND a XXXX XXXX against all odds. Because I didnt have access to knowledge on student loans and such growing up, I had to figure it out all on my own. I didnt have guidance and the Department of Education failed to properly provide guidance into Federal Student loans and such. I was not afforded the education or resources to make an informed decision. I was utilizing the XXXX XXXX  my XXXX XXXX sponsor signed to me and was still pushed to get Federal Loans to complete my degree. I was under significant financial and XXXX  duress at the time because my spouse had just XXXX, 2 months after having our son. My grandmother, who raised me, died a few weeks into his XXXX. I was raising a XXXX  and a XXXX XXXX XXXX at the time. Nelnet is a predator loan servicing company who kept freely pushing for me to take loans without actually explaining anything. I was not in a right state of mind and Nelnet is a private company who profits off oppressed populations such as myself. They have not attempted to help me, their interest is set to keep XXXX, educated women like myself in financial distress. Nelnet is not an ethical company. I have worked with the XXXX Government for YEARS and have been a Federal XXXX for years. I have served this country as a XXXX XXXX and a Therapist and even that doesnt qualify me for student loans repayments???? Nelnet make it IMPOSSIBLE to pay off their predatory loans. It is a XXXX and oppressive system that keeps non-white individuals like myself from truly succeeding.
I am filing this complaint against Nelnet due to severe and unjustified negative credit reporting that has significantly impacted my financial standing. My credit report was recently updated to reflect late payment entries from Nelnet student loan, which has caused my credit score to drop by over XXXX points. This action was taken without any prior notice, warning, or correspondenceI did not receive any emails, letters, or alerts informing me of this drastic change before it was reported to the credit bureaus. 

Additionally, I have become aware of an ongoing data breach involving student loan accounts, which raises serious concerns regarding unauthorized access to my personal and financial information raising concerns over a FERPA violation. Given this security lapse, I have reason to believe that my account records may have been compromised or altered without my consent. 

I am in the process of purchasing a home and this has caused my loan to be halted until this is remedied. This has caused extreme financial distress and this error in reporting needs to be remedied immediately. I did not authorize any changes to my account status, and I no longer feel comfortable having my student loans serviced and reported to the credit bureaus under these conditions. 

Violations and Consumer Protection Rights 1. Failure to Provide Notice of Negative Credit Reporting - Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), loan servicers are required to provide accurate and fair reporting. I was not notified in advance that these accounts would be marked late, which denied me the opportunity to address any potential issues before they were reported.

2. Possible Unauthorized Reporting and Account Compromise Due to Data Breach - The reported data breach involving Nelnet raises serious questions about the integrity of my loan accounts. If my data was exposed or manipulated, Nelnet may have
incorrectly or fraudulently reported late payments that I did not actually incur.

3. Failure to Properly Investigate and Verify Account Status - Given the security risks and errors in reporting, I request full verification and documentation proving the legitimacy of the late payments, including a detailed account history showing how and when they were marked late.
I have XXXX XXXX  that are in the process of being discharged due to misconduct by my school. This process is called borrowers defense, and applies to my loans from the XXXX XXXX. I have attached the emails regarding notification of this matter. According to the Department of Education and Nelnet, this process can take many years. In addition, there is no where I can go as the borrower to see the progress or status of this process. During this process, there should be no negative consequences or impact on me as the borrower. Part of the process for the discharge is a refund of all payments made towards the loans. Due to multiple changes in servicers over the years and the fact that my loans were consolidated, there was very little information available about the specifics of these loans from the very beginning of the process. I previously asked Nelnet in late XXXX for a record of all payments and loans- and I was told at that time that the information was unavailable due to the processing of the borrowers defense case. They did inform me that I would be getting a refund of approximately {$600.00}, which is the full amount they said I paid on these loans in over 10 years. I had serious doubts about that amount, but had XXXX recourse to prove otherwise. They informed me that the payment would be coming from the XXXX Treasury and provided instructions on how to sign up for direct deposit through the IRS website. I enrolled in direct deposit, and on XX/XX/XXXX, I received a deposit in the amount of {$690.00} from the XXXX Treasury. Due to not expecting any other payment, I contacted Nelnet and they confirmed that this is the refund for my borrowers defense case. They informed me that the Department of Education would be sending correspondence to confirm this, but nothing was received. I had spent another few hours at this point between calling Nelnet and the Department of Education, and I let it all go assuming itd all be made clear when the process was complete. 

I enrolled in school for the winter of XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX ) with no issues, and all loans were put into a forbearance status due to being a XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was eligible for financial aid at this point. I took the next semester off, and began the process to enroll for XXXX XXXX. I am going to a different school, so I had to login to update my XXXX form at the beginning of XX/XX/XXXX. Upon logging into the Department of Education, there was a bold warning about my loans being in default. I immediately contacted the Department of Education - because my loans are absolutely not in default and even if they were, there is absolutely no way they could go from good standing in XX/XX/XXXX to default in XX/XX/XXXX due to the amount of time needed to get into a default status. The Department of Education informed me that Nelnet, as the servicer, of these loans is solely responsible for updating loan status. I was told to contact Nelnet. Upping logging into the Nelnet website, there is no information about any late payments, default status or record of the defaulted loans. They are not even reported on my loan history. I called Nelnet, and I was informed that the process of refunding payments during a loan discharge can put the loan into a erroneous status of default. They informed me that there was nothing they could do about this, and I had to wait for the borrowers defense case to be resolved and all information would be updated and made right at that time. I requested a supervisor, who reiterated that there was nothing they could do and that this was just part of the process. I informed them that due to being in a default status, I can not return to school and obtain XXXX XXXX, and there are serious consequences to my credit report. In addition, when the government returns to wage garnishments in XX/XX/XXXX, my wages will be garnished for a defaulted loan that I dont owe. Nelnet again told me they had no solution, and that I just had to wait. They were unable to provide any specific timeline, but did inform me that it will likely be a year or more before any update is made to my account. They informed me that this is because the Department of Education controls all processing and they generally take 3-5 years in total for a borrowers defense case. 

I filed a complaint with the XXXX Department of Education to attempt to resolve this matter in early XX/XX/XXXX, however there has been no resolution to date. I have attached records of my Nelnet account, Department of Education account, deposit of refund, and original emails informing me of approval of my borrowers defense case. There is no other correspondence available by either entity, nor any other correspondence sent to me.

input.question: What issues are being raised regarding Nelnet in the consumer's complaint?
input.answer:
The issues being raised regarding Nelnet in the consumer's complaints include:

1. **Failure to Respond to Complaints and Correct Errors:** Consumers reported that Nelnet did not respond to multiple certified mail complaints detailing misconduct and violations of consumer protection laws, and failed to correct errors on their accounts.

5. **Incorrect Default Status and Loan Discharges:** Consumers reported that Nelnet erroneously marked loans as in default during the borrower defense process, which impacted their ability to return to school and caused credit and financial issues.

6. **Lack of Transparency and Account Status Updates:** Consumers expressed frustration over the inability to access clear information about the status of their loans, especially during discharge or defense processes, and Nelnet's failure to provide timely updates.

7. **Delays in Processing and Resolution:** Consumers noted that Nelnet indicated that resolving issues related to borrower defense claims or loan status updates could take years, with no specific timelines provided.

Overall, the complaints depict Nelnet as failing to respond adequately to consumer concerns, engaging in questionable practices, and causing significant financial and credit distress through errors, lack of communication, and alleged misconduct.

input.question: What does it mean that I was told I am in forbearance until 2040 but I have no written proof and what should I do about the long wait and disconnection problems with my student loan lender?
input.context:
Since the resumption of federal loan payments I have received little to no contact last time I called they said I was in forbearance until 2040 but nothing in writing. I am having trouble logging in with my credentials and when you call for assistance there is a long wait then a disconnection once someone finally comes to the phone.lack of transparency and accountability has caused undue stress.
I have already complained about my student loan servicer Aidvantage in XXXX. I was supposed to have been placed in a XXXX interest forbearance at that time, and since then I have been making payments but my balance owed has actually gone up. Attempts to ascertain the reason for this have been fruitless, including inexplicably being disconnected from chat due to " being idle for too long '' although I was not idle. I just want to know that my payments are being received and are applied to the balance owed in a fair manner and it is extraordinarily difficult to figure this out compared to any other financial institution I have worked with. The previous complaint resolution mentioned that payments made during forbearance will count toward future payments, does this mean my account balance remains unchanged even as I make payments? Do I have the option to apply these payments directly to principle? Why has my balance owed increased?
Thank you for giving me a voice to express concern and frustration. For the last 15 years, I have tried DOZENS of times to dispute the amount that the student loan people have been charging me. 

I graduated college in XXXX and my wife, likewise, graduated in XXXX. Shortly thereafter, we combined our loans. In XXXX, I even went through bankruptcy and was told student loans were off-limits. I am a XXXX XXXX and have good number-sense, so in the early XXXX 's, I felt that the interest and totals I was being charged for were inaccurate. I started making calls and got nowhere. 

Not knowing the details of the law, in about XXXX, I wrote a letter asking if this was something that could be settled ( like an IRS bill ), explaining that I was nearing retirement age and may be no longer able to pay the full amount, to which I never received a reply. 

In XXXX, my wife applied for and was approved for a XXXX discharge. After the payments were resumed, there was no lowering of the amount of our combined loan. I made several calls about this and asked for proof that my wife 's portion of the loans were actually discharged from our combined loan. 

In XXXX, they sent me a redacted promissory note that shows all of the individual loans that were added to the combined loan, but any dates or colleges that they are tied appear to be redated. I made literally dozens of calls since that time that got nowhere. 

When I bought my current house in XXXX and again when I refinanced in XXXX, I even had to have the student loan people verify to the mortgage loan people that my loans were in dispute so that I could obtain those loans. 

After my loan was transferred to another servicer - YET AGAIN - I asked for proof and they sent me the same exact redacted promissory note. 

Because of the runaround, and the multiple changes to my loan servicer over the years, it is my feeling that the student loan people have no way to actually prove the exact total of student loans, an accurate accounting of any payments I have made, an accurate accounting of interest accumulated, nor any proof that my wife 's loans were actually removed from the account. 

In the civilian world, this would be grounds for breach of contract and voiding of the loan ( s ). I've had several lawyers tell me I have an easy case to win, but I do not have the means to do so, so I am depending on you fine folks to make this situation right. It should not be legal for the government to send me a bill for a loan that they can actually prove I owe. 

Thank you for your time and effort.
Complaint : Drastically increased my monthly payment, not approving IDR applications, and screwing up a refund for four months. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX my student loan balance was {$36000.00}, and I was making {$200.00} monthly payments for years. I went back to school in XX/XX/XXXX and went on In-School Deferment.

In-School Deferment sends XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX = {$50000.00}. 

Only a few days before XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage says I have {$750.00} due on that day as my first payment. Begrudgingly I pay via XXXX as I don't want my count to go delinquent. I call Aidvantage and ask why this amount is so large compared to what I am historically used to paying. They have no answer and can't lower it. I apply for SAVE plan at this time. They confirmed I provided all documents and just need to wait for approval. They do NOT put me on another forbearance due to my application. 

XX/XX/XXXX I get an email notification saying my account is delinquent, and that I owe {$240.00} right now, despite paying {$750.00} via XXXX, and balance owed was XXXX just XXXX days prior. I manually pay {$240.00}, and then I call in an ask why this happened. They have no answer and never give me an answer. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on XXXX application status. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on SAVE application status. I call in and ask the status of my SAVE application. They can not find my application until I give them specific dates, and miraculously they find my application. They then tell me that they didn't receive any of my require income documentation despite my sending in months prior and being told it all looks good. Because of this, my original application was never considered. I am angry, I provide them with Income docs, and they restart my application. They put me on a two month application forbearance at this time. 

XX/XX/XXXX my forbearance ends. Next day I see I owe now {$980.00} per month starting in THREE DAYS!!! Three days advanced notice of another wild price jump. I immediately cancel XXXX as I do not trust it due to earlier problems. I manually pay {$980.00} and it is applied to my account on the XX/XX/XXXX due date. However, also on XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage takes {$760.00} from my bank account via XXXX, despite cancelling XXXX a week prior!!! So now they have a total of {$1700.00} payment from me for month of XX/XX/XXXX. 

I call Aidvantage and complain. It takes XXXX minutes into the call before they even admit to the mistake. I tell them to use that extra payment and apply it to my future account so that I do not owe for next month. They say this is acceptable. 

XX/XX/XXXX I notice the {$760.00} completely disappears from my " Recent Payments '' section in Aidvantage XXXX. Confuse, I call in and they tell me a refund has been issued for {$760.00}. I complain that I didn't want a refund, and they ignored me, but then I say " whatever '', I will wait for this refund. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account updates saying my next payment is due on XX/XX/XXXX, and that it is for {$400.00}. I manually pay this amount. Completely frustrated, I call into Aidvantage and ask again for the status of my refund, AND I ask for the status of my SAVE Plan application. They say applications aren't processing right now. As for my refund, they say the original ticket was put in incorrectly and the refund was never issued. They escalate the ticket at this time and I am told the {$760.00} refund process is starting over. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page updates in Aidvantage saying that my next payment is {$960.00}, due on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am angry at this point and say I don't care about the SAVE plan anymore, and ask if there is another IDR plan they are accepting applications for at this time? I'm told I can try the ICR plan which would bring my monthly payment down to {$600.00} a month. I tell them to cancel my SAVE Plan application, and start a new application for ICR Plan. I provide all of my documents. They put me on a two month NON-interest accruing forbearance while this application is being reviewed. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I get notification that my account has update, but instead of my account page saying that I owe {$0.00} for XX/XX/XXXX, I am instead now delinquent and that I owe {$6.00} due NOW. I manually pay this amount. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( today ) I call Aidvantage. I tell them I still have not received my {$760.00} refund which was first initiated XX/XX/XXXX. They research my tickets and now tell me the original refund ticket was put in for {$400.00}, which is wrong. I told them this is not true, otherwise why did {$760.00} disappear from my recent payments. It was clearly approved for refund. The Aidvantage representative can not tell me why the refund hasn't been completed yet, and that they are putting in another escalation for this today, with a processing estimate of another XXXX to XXXX weeks. 

I also ask the representative for the status of my new XXXX plan application. She tells me that all ICR applications are not being reviewed right now. I say " Wait, I was TOLD on XX/XX/XXXX that ICR plans ARE being reviewed, and this is the entire reason I cancelled my SAVE plan applcation in the first place. Now I'm being told that this is not true, and that ALL Income-driven repayment plans are on pause, not just SAVE. I was either lied to or given false information, and this caused me to cancel my SAVE application that had been in processing for six months.

I am ALSO now told that the two-month non-interest accruing forbearance I was put on these past two month is ACTUALLY an interest accruing forbearance. Another lie told to me on XX/XX/XXXX. 

The current representative tells me that my next payment is due XX/XX/XXXX, but she can not tell me how much it will be. She said the system will automatically put me in forbearance if my newer XXXX plan application hasn't been approved yet, but I know this is a lie. It has never done this before. I'm told if it doesn't do it automatically, that I should call them a week before the XXXX payment is due. 

Based on history pattern, I fully expect my XX/XX/XXXX payment to now be even HIGHER, and it won't appear on my account until a couple days before it is due. This company is paying with lives, I CAN NOT afford a {$1000.00} payment every month and I'm been attempting to get it lowered for XXXX months now. 

If I have to pick between paying mortgage/feeding my child, and paying this XXXX student loan, this student loan is going into default. I don't even XXXX care anymore about my credit. I own everything I need already. Aidvantage does not want to work with me and thinks bullying me into submission via incompetence will just force me to pay higher payments.

input.question: What does it mean that I was told I am in forbearance until 2040 but I have no written proof and what should I do about the long wait and disconnection problems with my student loan lender?
input.answer:
It sounds like you are in a difficult situation with your student loan, especially since you have no written proof of being in forbearance until 2040 and are experiencing communication and disconnection issues with your lender. Here's what you should consider doing:

1. **Request Written Confirmation:** Contact your loan servicer in writing (via email or certified mail) to formally request documentation of your forbearance status, including the specific terms and duration. Keep records of all correspondence.

2. **Check Your Account Online:** If possible, try to access your account through the official student loan portal to verify your current status, payment history, and any forbearance or deferment details.

3. **File a Complaint or Seek Assistance:** If you're unable to get clear information or face ongoing issues, consider reaching out to the Federal Student Aid Ombudsman Group. They can help resolve disputes with loan servicers.

4. **Address Disconnection and Wait Times:** For long wait times and disconnections, try calling during off-peak hours or using online chat or email options if available. Document your attempts to contact them.

5. **Explore Alternative Contact Methods:** If phone contact is problematic, consider submitting a formal written inquiry or complaint through the Federal Student Aid website or the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB).

6. **Legal and Consumer Protections:** Given the lack of transparency and potential miscommunication, consulting a legal professional or a student loan counselor might help clarify your rights and options.

7. **Stay Informed:** Keep detailed records of all payments, communications, and attempts to resolve issues. This documentation can be useful if you need to escalate your case or seek legal advice.

Remember, you do not have to accept verbal assurances alone—request everything in writing for your records. If your lender continues to be unresponsive or provides inconsistent information, reporting the issue to federal agencies like the CFPB or the Department of Education can also be helpful.

If you are feeling overwhelmed, consider reaching out to a student loan counselor or a consumer rights organization for personalized assistance.

input.context:
Since the resumption of federal loan payments I have received little to no contact last time I called they said I was in forbearance until 2040 but nothing in writing. I am having trouble logging in with my credentials and when you call for assistance there is a long wait then a disconnection once someone finally comes to the phone.lack of transparency and accountability has caused undue stress.
I have already complained about my student loan servicer Aidvantage in XXXX. I was supposed to have been placed in a XXXX interest forbearance at that time, and since then I have been making payments but my balance owed has actually gone up. Attempts to ascertain the reason for this have been fruitless, including inexplicably being disconnected from chat due to " being idle for too long '' although I was not idle. I just want to know that my payments are being received and are applied to the balance owed in a fair manner and it is extraordinarily difficult to figure this out compared to any other financial institution I have worked with. The previous complaint resolution mentioned that payments made during forbearance will count toward future payments, does this mean my account balance remains unchanged even as I make payments? Do I have the option to apply these payments directly to principle? Why has my balance owed increased?
Thank you for giving me a voice to express concern and frustration. For the last 15 years, I have tried DOZENS of times to dispute the amount that the student loan people have been charging me. 

I graduated college in XXXX and my wife, likewise, graduated in XXXX. Shortly thereafter, we combined our loans. In XXXX, I even went through bankruptcy and was told student loans were off-limits. I am a XXXX XXXX and have good number-sense, so in the early XXXX 's, I felt that the interest and totals I was being charged for were inaccurate. I started making calls and got nowhere. 

Not knowing the details of the law, in about XXXX, I wrote a letter asking if this was something that could be settled ( like an IRS bill ), explaining that I was nearing retirement age and may be no longer able to pay the full amount, to which I never received a reply. 

In XXXX, my wife applied for and was approved for a XXXX discharge. After the payments were resumed, there was no lowering of the amount of our combined loan. I made several calls about this and asked for proof that my wife 's portion of the loans were actually discharged from our combined loan. 

In XXXX, they sent me a redacted promissory note that shows all of the individual loans that were added to the combined loan, but any dates or colleges that they are tied appear to be redated. I made literally dozens of calls since that time that got nowhere. 

When I bought my current house in XXXX and again when I refinanced in XXXX, I even had to have the student loan people verify to the mortgage loan people that my loans were in dispute so that I could obtain those loans. 

After my loan was transferred to another servicer - YET AGAIN - I asked for proof and they sent me the same exact redacted promissory note. 

Because of the runaround, and the multiple changes to my loan servicer over the years, it is my feeling that the student loan people have no way to actually prove the exact total of student loans, an accurate accounting of any payments I have made, an accurate accounting of interest accumulated, nor any proof that my wife 's loans were actually removed from the account. 

In the civilian world, this would be grounds for breach of contract and voiding of the loan ( s ). I've had several lawyers tell me I have an easy case to win, but I do not have the means to do so, so I am depending on you fine folks to make this situation right. It should not be legal for the government to send me a bill for a loan that they can actually prove I owe. 

Thank you for your time and effort.
Complaint : Drastically increased my monthly payment, not approving IDR applications, and screwing up a refund for four months. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX my student loan balance was {$36000.00}, and I was making {$200.00} monthly payments for years. I went back to school in XX/XX/XXXX and went on In-School Deferment.

In-School Deferment sends XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX = {$50000.00}. 

Only a few days before XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage says I have {$750.00} due on that day as my first payment. Begrudgingly I pay via XXXX as I don't want my count to go delinquent. I call Aidvantage and ask why this amount is so large compared to what I am historically used to paying. They have no answer and can't lower it. I apply for SAVE plan at this time. They confirmed I provided all documents and just need to wait for approval. They do NOT put me on another forbearance due to my application. 

XX/XX/XXXX I get an email notification saying my account is delinquent, and that I owe {$240.00} right now, despite paying {$750.00} via XXXX, and balance owed was XXXX just XXXX days prior. I manually pay {$240.00}, and then I call in an ask why this happened. They have no answer and never give me an answer. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on XXXX application status. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on SAVE application status. I call in and ask the status of my SAVE application. They can not find my application until I give them specific dates, and miraculously they find my application. They then tell me that they didn't receive any of my require income documentation despite my sending in months prior and being told it all looks good. Because of this, my original application was never considered. I am angry, I provide them with Income docs, and they restart my application. They put me on a two month application forbearance at this time. 

XX/XX/XXXX my forbearance ends. Next day I see I owe now {$980.00} per month starting in THREE DAYS!!! Three days advanced notice of another wild price jump. I immediately cancel XXXX as I do not trust it due to earlier problems. I manually pay {$980.00} and it is applied to my account on the XX/XX/XXXX due date. However, also on XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage takes {$760.00} from my bank account via XXXX, despite cancelling XXXX a week prior!!! So now they have a total of {$1700.00} payment from me for month of XX/XX/XXXX. 

I call Aidvantage and complain. It takes XXXX minutes into the call before they even admit to the mistake. I tell them to use that extra payment and apply it to my future account so that I do not owe for next month. They say this is acceptable. 

XX/XX/XXXX I notice the {$760.00} completely disappears from my " Recent Payments '' section in Aidvantage XXXX. Confuse, I call in and they tell me a refund has been issued for {$760.00}. I complain that I didn't want a refund, and they ignored me, but then I say " whatever '', I will wait for this refund. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account updates saying my next payment is due on XX/XX/XXXX, and that it is for {$400.00}. I manually pay this amount. Completely frustrated, I call into Aidvantage and ask again for the status of my refund, AND I ask for the status of my SAVE Plan application. They say applications aren't processing right now. As for my refund, they say the original ticket was put in incorrectly and the refund was never issued. They escalate the ticket at this time and I am told the {$760.00} refund process is starting over. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page updates in Aidvantage saying that my next payment is {$960.00}, due on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am angry at this point and say I don't care about the SAVE plan anymore, and ask if there is another IDR plan they are accepting applications for at this time? I'm told I can try the ICR plan which would bring my monthly payment down to {$600.00} a month. I tell them to cancel my SAVE Plan application, and start a new application for ICR Plan. I provide all of my documents. They put me on a two month NON-interest accruing forbearance while this application is being reviewed. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I get notification that my account has update, but instead of my account page saying that I owe {$0.00} for XX/XX/XXXX, I am instead now delinquent and that I owe {$6.00} due NOW. I manually pay this amount. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( today ) I call Aidvantage. I tell them I still have not received my {$760.00} refund which was first initiated XX/XX/XXXX. They research my tickets and now tell me the original refund ticket was put in for {$400.00}, which is wrong. I told them this is not true, otherwise why did {$760.00} disappear from my recent payments. It was clearly approved for refund. The Aidvantage representative can not tell me why the refund hasn't been completed yet, and that they are putting in another escalation for this today, with a processing estimate of another XXXX to XXXX weeks. 

I also ask the representative for the status of my new XXXX plan application. She tells me that all ICR applications are not being reviewed right now. I say " Wait, I was TOLD on XX/XX/XXXX that ICR plans ARE being reviewed, and this is the entire reason I cancelled my SAVE plan applcation in the first place. Now I'm being told that this is not true, and that ALL Income-driven repayment plans are on pause, not just SAVE. I was either lied to or given false information, and this caused me to cancel my SAVE application that had been in processing for six months.

I am ALSO now told that the two-month non-interest accruing forbearance I was put on these past two month is ACTUALLY an interest accruing forbearance. Another lie told to me on XX/XX/XXXX. 

The current representative tells me that my next payment is due XX/XX/XXXX, but she can not tell me how much it will be. She said the system will automatically put me in forbearance if my newer XXXX plan application hasn't been approved yet, but I know this is a lie. It has never done this before. I'm told if it doesn't do it automatically, that I should call them a week before the XXXX payment is due. 

Based on history pattern, I fully expect my XX/XX/XXXX payment to now be even HIGHER, and it won't appear on my account until a couple days before it is due. This company is paying with lives, I CAN NOT afford a {$1000.00} payment every month and I'm been attempting to get it lowered for XXXX months now. 

If I have to pick between paying mortgage/feeding my child, and paying this XXXX student loan, this student loan is going into default. I don't even XXXX care anymore about my credit. I own everything I need already. Aidvantage does not want to work with me and thinks bullying me into submission via incompetence will just force me to pay higher payments.

input.response:
It sounds like you are in a difficult situation with your student loan, especially since you have no written proof of being in forbearance until 2040 and are experiencing communication and disconnection issues with your lender. Here's what you should consider doing:

1. **Request Written Confirmation:** Contact your loan servicer in writing (via email or certified mail) to formally request documentation of your forbearance status, including the specific terms and duration. Keep records of all correspondence.

2. **Check Your Account Online:** If possible, try to access your account through the official student loan portal to verify your current status, payment history, and any forbearance or deferment details.

3. **File a Complaint or Seek Assistance:** If you're unable to get clear information or face ongoing issues, consider reaching out to the Federal Student Aid Ombudsman Group. They can help resolve disputes with loan servicers.

4. **Address Disconnection and Wait Times:** For long wait times and disconnections, try calling during off-peak hours or using online chat or email options if available. Document your attempts to contact them.

5. **Explore Alternative Contact Methods:** If phone contact is problematic, consider submitting a formal written inquiry or complaint through the Federal Student Aid website or the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB).

6. **Legal and Consumer Protections:** Given the lack of transparency and potential miscommunication, consulting a legal professional or a student loan counselor might help clarify your rights and options.

7. **Stay Informed:** Keep detailed records of all payments, communications, and attempts to resolve issues. This documentation can be useful if you need to escalate your case or seek legal advice.

Remember, you do not have to accept verbal assurances alone—request everything in writing for your records. If your lender continues to be unresponsive or provides inconsistent information, reporting the issue to federal agencies like the CFPB or the Department of Education can also be helpful.

If you are feeling overwhelmed, consider reaching out to a student loan counselor or a consumer rights organization for personalized assistance.

output.question: What should I do if I have no written proof of my student loan forbearance and am having communication issues with my lender?

input.text:
Since the resumption of federal loan payments I have received little to no contact last time I called they said I was in forbearance until 2040 but nothing in writing. I am having trouble logging in with my credentials and when you call for assistance there is a long wait then a disconnection once someone finally comes to the phone.lack of transparency and accountability has caused undue stress.
I have already complained about my student loan servicer Aidvantage in XXXX. I was supposed to have been placed in a XXXX interest forbearance at that time, and since then I have been making payments but my balance owed has actually gone up. Attempts to ascertain the reason for this have been fruitless, including inexplicably being disconnected from chat due to " being idle for too long '' although I was not idle. I just want to know that my payments are being received and are applied to the balance owed in a fair manner and it is extraordinarily difficult to figure this out compared to any other financial institution I have worked with. The previous complaint resolution mentioned that payments made during forbearance will count toward future payments, does this mean my account balance remains unchanged even as I make payments? Do I have the option to apply these payments directly to principle? Why has my balance owed increased?
Thank you for giving me a voice to express concern and frustration. For the last 15 years, I have tried DOZENS of times to dispute the amount that the student loan people have been charging me. 

I graduated college in XXXX and my wife, likewise, graduated in XXXX. Shortly thereafter, we combined our loans. In XXXX, I even went through bankruptcy and was told student loans were off-limits. I am a XXXX XXXX and have good number-sense, so in the early XXXX 's, I felt that the interest and totals I was being charged for were inaccurate. I started making calls and got nowhere. 

Not knowing the details of the law, in about XXXX, I wrote a letter asking if this was something that could be settled ( like an IRS bill ), explaining that I was nearing retirement age and may be no longer able to pay the full amount, to which I never received a reply. 

In XXXX, my wife applied for and was approved for a XXXX discharge. After the payments were resumed, there was no lowering of the amount of our combined loan. I made several calls about this and asked for proof that my wife 's portion of the loans were actually discharged from our combined loan. 

In XXXX, they sent me a redacted promissory note that shows all of the individual loans that were added to the combined loan, but any dates or colleges that they are tied appear to be redated. I made literally dozens of calls since that time that got nowhere. 

When I bought my current house in XXXX and again when I refinanced in XXXX, I even had to have the student loan people verify to the mortgage loan people that my loans were in dispute so that I could obtain those loans. 

After my loan was transferred to another servicer - YET AGAIN - I asked for proof and they sent me the same exact redacted promissory note. 

Because of the runaround, and the multiple changes to my loan servicer over the years, it is my feeling that the student loan people have no way to actually prove the exact total of student loans, an accurate accounting of any payments I have made, an accurate accounting of interest accumulated, nor any proof that my wife 's loans were actually removed from the account. 

In the civilian world, this would be grounds for breach of contract and voiding of the loan ( s ). I've had several lawyers tell me I have an easy case to win, but I do not have the means to do so, so I am depending on you fine folks to make this situation right. It should not be legal for the government to send me a bill for a loan that they can actually prove I owe. 

Thank you for your time and effort.
Complaint : Drastically increased my monthly payment, not approving IDR applications, and screwing up a refund for four months. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX my student loan balance was {$36000.00}, and I was making {$200.00} monthly payments for years. I went back to school in XX/XX/XXXX and went on In-School Deferment.

In-School Deferment sends XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX = {$50000.00}. 

Only a few days before XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage says I have {$750.00} due on that day as my first payment. Begrudgingly I pay via XXXX as I don't want my count to go delinquent. I call Aidvantage and ask why this amount is so large compared to what I am historically used to paying. They have no answer and can't lower it. I apply for SAVE plan at this time. They confirmed I provided all documents and just need to wait for approval. They do NOT put me on another forbearance due to my application. 

XX/XX/XXXX I get an email notification saying my account is delinquent, and that I owe {$240.00} right now, despite paying {$750.00} via XXXX, and balance owed was XXXX just XXXX days prior. I manually pay {$240.00}, and then I call in an ask why this happened. They have no answer and never give me an answer. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on XXXX application status. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on SAVE application status. I call in and ask the status of my SAVE application. They can not find my application until I give them specific dates, and miraculously they find my application. They then tell me that they didn't receive any of my require income documentation despite my sending in months prior and being told it all looks good. Because of this, my original application was never considered. I am angry, I provide them with Income docs, and they restart my application. They put me on a two month application forbearance at this time. 

XX/XX/XXXX my forbearance ends. Next day I see I owe now {$980.00} per month starting in THREE DAYS!!! Three days advanced notice of another wild price jump. I immediately cancel XXXX as I do not trust it due to earlier problems. I manually pay {$980.00} and it is applied to my account on the XX/XX/XXXX due date. However, also on XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage takes {$760.00} from my bank account via XXXX, despite cancelling XXXX a week prior!!! So now they have a total of {$1700.00} payment from me for month of XX/XX/XXXX. 

I call Aidvantage and complain. It takes XXXX minutes into the call before they even admit to the mistake. I tell them to use that extra payment and apply it to my future account so that I do not owe for next month. They say this is acceptable. 

XX/XX/XXXX I notice the {$760.00} completely disappears from my " Recent Payments '' section in Aidvantage XXXX. Confuse, I call in and they tell me a refund has been issued for {$760.00}. I complain that I didn't want a refund, and they ignored me, but then I say " whatever '', I will wait for this refund. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account updates saying my next payment is due on XX/XX/XXXX, and that it is for {$400.00}. I manually pay this amount. Completely frustrated, I call into Aidvantage and ask again for the status of my refund, AND I ask for the status of my SAVE Plan application. They say applications aren't processing right now. As for my refund, they say the original ticket was put in incorrectly and the refund was never issued. They escalate the ticket at this time and I am told the {$760.00} refund process is starting over. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page updates in Aidvantage saying that my next payment is {$960.00}, due on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am angry at this point and say I don't care about the SAVE plan anymore, and ask if there is another IDR plan they are accepting applications for at this time? I'm told I can try the ICR plan which would bring my monthly payment down to {$600.00} a month. I tell them to cancel my SAVE Plan application, and start a new application for ICR Plan. I provide all of my documents. They put me on a two month NON-interest accruing forbearance while this application is being reviewed. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I get notification that my account has update, but instead of my account page saying that I owe {$0.00} for XX/XX/XXXX, I am instead now delinquent and that I owe {$6.00} due NOW. I manually pay this amount. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( today ) I call Aidvantage. I tell them I still have not received my {$760.00} refund which was first initiated XX/XX/XXXX. They research my tickets and now tell me the original refund ticket was put in for {$400.00}, which is wrong. I told them this is not true, otherwise why did {$760.00} disappear from my recent payments. It was clearly approved for refund. The Aidvantage representative can not tell me why the refund hasn't been completed yet, and that they are putting in another escalation for this today, with a processing estimate of another XXXX to XXXX weeks. 

I also ask the representative for the status of my new XXXX plan application. She tells me that all ICR applications are not being reviewed right now. I say " Wait, I was TOLD on XX/XX/XXXX that ICR plans ARE being reviewed, and this is the entire reason I cancelled my SAVE plan applcation in the first place. Now I'm being told that this is not true, and that ALL Income-driven repayment plans are on pause, not just SAVE. I was either lied to or given false information, and this caused me to cancel my SAVE application that had been in processing for six months.

I am ALSO now told that the two-month non-interest accruing forbearance I was put on these past two month is ACTUALLY an interest accruing forbearance. Another lie told to me on XX/XX/XXXX. 

The current representative tells me that my next payment is due XX/XX/XXXX, but she can not tell me how much it will be. She said the system will automatically put me in forbearance if my newer XXXX plan application hasn't been approved yet, but I know this is a lie. It has never done this before. I'm told if it doesn't do it automatically, that I should call them a week before the XXXX payment is due. 

Based on history pattern, I fully expect my XX/XX/XXXX payment to now be even HIGHER, and it won't appear on my account until a couple days before it is due. This company is paying with lives, I CAN NOT afford a {$1000.00} payment every month and I'm been attempting to get it lowered for XXXX months now. 

If I have to pick between paying mortgage/feeding my child, and paying this XXXX student loan, this student loan is going into default. I don't even XXXX care anymore about my credit. I own everything I need already. Aidvantage does not want to work with me and thinks bullying me into submission via incompetence will just force me to pay higher payments.

input.question: What does it mean that I was told I am in forbearance until 2040 but I have no written proof and what should I do about the long wait and disconnection problems with my student loan lender?
input.answer:
It sounds like you are in a difficult situation with your student loan, especially since you have no written proof of being in forbearance until 2040 and are experiencing communication and disconnection issues with your lender. Here's what you should consider doing:

1. **Request Written Confirmation:** Contact your loan servicer in writing (via email or certified mail) to formally request documentation of your forbearance status, including the specific terms and duration. Keep records of all correspondence.

2. **Check Your Account Online:** If possible, try to access your account through the official student loan portal to verify your current status, payment history, and any forbearance or deferment details.

3. **File a Complaint or Seek Assistance:** If you're unable to get clear information or face ongoing issues, consider reaching out to the Federal Student Aid Ombudsman Group. They can help resolve disputes with loan servicers.

4. **Address Disconnection and Wait Times:** For long wait times and disconnections, try calling during off-peak hours or using online chat or email options if available. Document your attempts to contact them.

5. **Explore Alternative Contact Methods:** If phone contact is problematic, consider submitting a formal written inquiry or complaint through the Federal Student Aid website or the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB).

6. **Legal and Consumer Protections:** Given the lack of transparency and potential miscommunication, consulting a legal professional or a student loan counselor might help clarify your rights and options.

7. **Stay Informed:** Keep detailed records of all payments, communications, and attempts to resolve issues. This documentation can be useful if you need to escalate your case or seek legal advice.

Remember, you do not have to accept verbal assurances alone—request everything in writing for your records. If your lender continues to be unresponsive or provides inconsistent information, reporting the issue to federal agencies like the CFPB or the Department of Education can also be helpful.

If you are feeling overwhelmed, consider reaching out to a student loan counselor or a consumer rights organization for personalized assistance.
